meanings.definition: In a theoretical or abstract manner
meanings.sent1: She notionally understood the concept, but struggled to apply it practically.
meanings.sent2: The scientist notionally explained the complex theory to the students.
meanings.sent3: Notionally speaking, the cat believed it could fly with its makeshift wings.
meanings.sent4: Her mind notionally traveled to distant galaxies as she read the science fiction novel.
meanings.sent5: The idea of time travel was notionally fascinating to the young students.

meanings.definition: Based on an idea or concept rather than reality
meanings.sent1: The notionally perfect plan fell apart when faced with real-world challenges.
meanings.sent2: His notionally brilliant invention turned out to be impractical in use.
meanings.sent3: The notionally invincible superhero slipped on a banana peel and fell.
meanings.sent4: The notionally solid ground beneath her feet turned out to be quicksand.
meanings.sent5: The notionally endless maze of corridors confused the explorers.

meanings.sent1: The thief notionally claimed innocence despite the evidence against him.
meanings.sent2: She notionally promised to return the borrowed book, but never did.
meanings.sent3: Notionally, the cat blamed the dog for knocking over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The notionally haunted house turned out to be a prank by the mischievous kids.
meanings.sent5: The notionally cursed treasure brought misfortune to all who sought it.
